Eventually, when the telomere gets too short, our cells can no longer divide. At that point, our cells die. Our bodies are made up of many, many cells, so when cells die, our bodies start to show signs of aging. Our skin gets wrinkles, our joints get stiff, and our hair turns gray. Our bodies also lose some of their ability to fight off diseases. This is why older people are more likely to get sick. This can help us stay healthy and strong as we get older.
